text: Hi there.  Have you ever thought about who the most vulnerable people are when a natural disaster strikes?  Or when there's political unrest?
That is something I do not think about.
Actually, I'm really troubled by the answer.  In countries like Syria, 1000 children have been killed during the civil war.  Isn't that insane?
That is terrible. I wish this wasn't true.

Seriously.  Adults often can't fend for themselves when there's a crisis, but children are especially vulnerable.  Do you think that if you could do something to help Syrian children or children in Indonesia, which just experienced an earthquake, you would?.
That would be something I would do, yes.
Yeah, me too.  Every day I watch the news and hear about victims all over the world and feel kind of powerless.
You have more power than you realize.
Can you elaborate.  How do you think people like us could help?
We could either donate money or our time.

Absolutely.  There are so many charities out there but I\'ve been researching one in particular called "Save the Children."  All of the money they collect goes straight to helping children in war torn parts of the world and places that have suffered natural disasters.
I will have to take a look at the website.
Is there any information that I could provide you with.  I really believe in this organization and think it's worthwhile.
How long has the organization been around?
It's actually been around since 1919, when it was founded by this woman in London right after World War I
What is the womens name that founded it?
I have to be honest with you.  I'm going to look that up.  Her name is Eglantyne Jebb.
Who runs the organization now?
Well, a woman named Carolyn Miles is the CEO.  Are you familiar with the organization?
No I am not, but like I said. I will look at it in the future.

I know I haven't given you that much info, but do you think you might want to donate part of your proceeds for this task to Save the Children?  It's a great NGO that is really making a difference in developing countries.
